unnormalised: Someone asked me the other day how much I actually *spend* on shopping each month. Honestly, I never really added it all up before. I just swipe my card and think, "It's fine, I deserve this." But then I thought, why not track it for a month and see? So, that's what I did.

unnormalised: First week of July, I went to D-Mart to stock up on groceries, spent around Rs. 3500. Then, my friend insisted we check out the new Zara store at Phoenix Mall. Ended up buying 2 dresses there, totaling about Rs. 6000. Ouch. Plus, I saw a really cool phone cover online for Rs. 499 and just *had* to have it. Impulse buy, I know!

Plus, I saw a really cool phone cover online for rupees four hundred and ninety nine and just had to have it. Impulse buy, I know!

unnormalised: Mid-month, I attended my cousin’s wedding. Had to buy a new saree, which set me back Rs. 8500 at Nalli Silks. Then, bought some matching jewelry from a local shop for Rs. 2000. I even treated myself to a new pair of heels online, priced at Rs 1799. Add to that the online sales, got shoes for rs 999!

unnormalised: The last couple of weeks were quieter, thankfully. But there was still that trip to Reliance Trends for new jeans (Rs. 1999), and a birthday gift for another friend (Rs. 1200 on Amazon). And who can forget the random snack runs at the local kirana store? Must’ve been at least Rs. 500 on chips and chai. The new fastrack watch on flipkart added another 3000 rupees

unnormalised: So, after adding everything up, I spent approximately Rs. 29997 on shopping in one month! That's… a lot more than I thought! Definitely need to cut back next month. Maybe I'll try setting a budget of Rs. 15000. Wish me luck!
